title.narrative: 006 CHILD PROTECTION AND EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: By 2015, at least three emergency - prone regions are able to provide child protection services to children affected by emergencies, which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2015, increased number of children who are registered, live in child-protecting families and communities and vulnerable children, including those in emergencies, benefit from gender sensitive and child friendly comprehensive interventions and services

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF House (Kazanchis - Opposite UNECA/German House) P.O. Box 1169 Addis Ababa

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2015, at least three emergency - prone regions are able to provide child protection services to children affected byemergencies

description.narrative: For the first time, Child Protection in Emergency was mainstreamed into the country's humanitarian response plan and implementation. CP/GBV Sub-cluster coordination is strengthened and UNICEF supported the placement of two full time staff that enhanced evidence generation as well as concerted approach to the ongoing drought response nationwide. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2016

title.narrative: No. of regions with functioning CPiE coordination structures

actual.value: 2016:Met. Six regions have sub clusters in place (Amhara , Oromia , Tigray , Somali , Afar and Gambella ) The establishment of sub cluster in all hotspot woredas with UNICEF supported child protection drought intervention areas is underway.

title.narrative: No of hot post woredas in 3 regions with established community structures capacitated to respond to child protection in emergencies

actual.value: 2016:Met. 51 woredas have rolled out trainings for community structures under the drought response initiative, 3 woredas received similar support in Gambella during the reporting period.

title.narrative: A functional federal child protection in emergencies coordination body support regions for prevention and response

actual.value: 2016:Met. UNICEF co-leads with UNFPA the federal CP/GBV inter agency sub cluster. In 2015 UNICEF has succeeded in mobilizing the MOWCA to engage in the sub cluster and coordination work. Although NGO participation has weakened in 2015, with the onset of the drought, the sub cluster is being reactivated
